page.title: 08HARBOUR TRAFFIC
page.content: Winter is the busiest time of the year at{St Sampson's harbour}. The biggest ship to use the harbour is a 260 foot long tanker.There are two parts of the harbour, the north and the south side. The{north side}has 6 berths where they unload sand,coal and timber . On the Northside they also unload heavy oil which goes by underground pipeline straight to the Power Station.At {Southside}there are 4 berths where oil,petrol and gas are unloaded.Cement is unloaded into silos from the boat Ronez.Other ships bring in bricks, fertiliser and lager from Holland. There has been a{safety wall}built at the harbour where the fuel and gas is unloaded in case of any leaks which may cause an explosion or fire. Recently a pipe carrying heavy oil to the Power Station cracked,{polluting the Harbour with oil.
